main event: An unidentified object was observed in Beavercreek, Ohio on March 4, 1964, described as a solid light that went out.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 5 minutes and was described as a stationary object at 30 degrees elevation., The object was reported to be visible on previous nights., The object was concluded to possibly be an astronomical phenomenon., The sighting was originally reported by a civilian., Venus was noted to be in the reported position and was lower and setting at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a solid light in the sky
witness description: a civilian who reported the sighting
